ci_support_linux_.yaml:
build_number_decrement:
- '0'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge,defaults
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- condaforge/linux-anvil-comp7
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- '2.7'

about.description:
Stefuna is a simple AWS Step Function Activity server framework. It
makes it incredibly quick and easy to write workers to process
activity tasks in Python.
about.summary: Write an AWS Step Function Activity Server with a few lines of Python

about.description:
Stefuna is a simple AWS Step Function Activity server framework. It
makes it incredibly quick and easy to write workers to process
activity tasks in Python.
about.summary: Write an AWS Step Function Activity Server with a few lines of Python

name: stefuna
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "stefuna" %}
{% set version = "1.0.1" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 83bf583d3127121ef2164dcb75c2a29c55882b872b23d4fa012060f003208ad5

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv"
  entry_points:
    - stefuna = stefuna.stefuna:main

requirements:
  host:
    - python >=3.4
    - pip
  run:
    - python >=3.4
    - boto3 >=1.4.6,<2.0.0

test:
  imports:
    - stefuna
  commands:
    - stefuna --help

about:
  home: https://github.com/irothschild/stefuna
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'Write an AWS Step Function Activity Server with a few lines of Python'

  description: |
    Stefuna is a simple AWS Step Function Activity server framework. It
    makes it incredibly quick and easy to write workers to process 
    activity tasks in Python.
  dev_url: https://github.com/irothschild/stefuna

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - sodre
